alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Dillon; Florence; Marion; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Florence, Dillon, east central Darlington, northwestern Marion and southeastern Marlboro Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 544 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms between Darlington and Florence, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Florence, Dillon, Darlington, Latta, Quinby, Sellers, Fork, Blue Brick, Mont Clare, Mars Bluff, Brownsville, Darlington Raceway, Florence Darlington Technical College Main Campus, Oak Grove, Francis Marion University, Bingham, Mechanicsville, Floydale, Smithboro and Little Rock. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 137 and 141. Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 157 and 196. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern South Carolina.
